intro: Sparaxis calcicola, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces strap-like leaves and has a short, sturdy stem. Sparaxis calcicola is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable conditions.
